intro: Cyphostemma njegerre, commonly known as the African moonvine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in shrublands and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
